Talk2011_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>For <clr:0000>three chillfin trout<clr:ffff>, I could give
you <clr:0000>10 arrows<clr:ffff>. Would that be all right?
Talk2014_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:TalkPositive_00>Please, come talk to me if you ever have 
ingredients you're not using!
Talk2012_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>For <clr:0000>five brightcaps<clr:ffff>, I could give you
<clr:0000>10 arrows<clr:ffff>. Would that be all right?
Talk1026_01:
<snd:Notice_01>Oh!<sp:5:1:0> Do you need to speak with Banji?<sp:5:1:0>
Apologiesâ€”we were caught up in our
conversation.
Talk1026:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I'm from <clr:0000>Rito Village<clr:ffff>, to the northwest.


<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Think_01>Times are tough where I'm from.
Merchants aren't able to reach my village
because of the <clr:0000>blizzard<clr:ffff>.
We're fortunate the kind folks from the
stable are sharing their supplies with us.

<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:LaughS_01>It's thanks to them that the children
still have full bellies.
Talk1027:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Chat_00>Don't mention it, really. The Rito have
been good neighbors to us. We're just
returning the favor.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0101>You let me know if there's anything else
you need, all right?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0101>I can arrange to have it sent here, and
then pack it up for you to carry home.
Talk2020:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think_00>The children really like <clr:0000><sp:c9:4:0>glowing cave fish<clr:ffff>,
<clr:0000>brightcaps<clr:ffff>, and<clr:0000> chillfin trout<clr:ffff>.<clr:0000><clr:ffff>

<sp:3:0:2:0701>If you have any of those, would you be
interested in a trade? Your ingredients in
exchange for my <clr:0000>arrows<clr:ffff>?
Talk1028:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Think_00>There's no telling when the harsh weather
at <clr:0000>Rito Village<clr:ffff> will let up... <sp:5:1:0>The blizzard is
still raging west of <clr:0000>Tabantha Great Bridge<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0101>But thanks to your generosity, <sp:5:0:0>we can
endure for the time being.
Talk2021:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Notice_01>Oh! <sp:5:0:0>Your pouch is full.<sp:5:1:0> Please come back
whenever you're low on arrows.
Talk2501:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:LaughL_01>Good morning!<sp:5:1:0> The sun's really shining
for us today, huh?

Every morning at dawn, my big sister,
Laissa, likes to go somewhere high up
and sunbathe.
I wonder if she's at her usual spot today.
Talk1029:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease_01>It's the least we can do, since traveling
merchants can't reach your village.

You need supplies, and we can afford to
share. Simple as that.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0101>Please, take as much as you need. I don't
want any Rito children going without food!
Talk2010_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>For <clr:0000>three glowing cave fish<clr:ffff>, I could give
you <clr:0000>10 arrows<clr:ffff>. Would that be all right?
Talk2502:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease_00>Good evening, Mr. Swordsman!<sp:5:1:0> Nice and
peaceful outside, hm?

You know, I'm really grateful for everyone
who helped us out during the blizzard.

<snd:Chat_00>So many people from outside the village
banded together to support us.

I just...<sp:5:1:0> I hope that someday I can return
the favor somehow.
Talk2010:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Hm... <sp:5:0:0>Would you take <clr:0000>10 arrows <clr:ffff>for
<clr:0000>three glowing cave fish<clr:ffff>?
Talk2503:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Greeting>Mr. Swordsman!<sp:5:1:0> It's good to see you.


I gotta say, the children can really eat.
I don't know how their little bellies hold
so much food!
Then again, they've been helping out still
even though the blizzard's over. Maybe all
that work is building up their appetites!
Talk2504:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Notice_00>I almost forgot to ask!<sp:5:1:0> Do you have any
ingredients you can spare for us?
Talk2013:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:TalkPositive_00>If you ever have spare ingredients,
let me know. I'll give you <clr:0000>arrows<clr:ffff> for them.
Talk2001:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:TalkPositive_01>You know, we still have a lot of firewood
and flint stockpiled.

Now that the blizzard's over, we don't
have much need for fire-making supplies.
So please take as much as you like!
<sp:3:0:2:0a01><snd:Sad_01>That said...<sp:5:0:0>we're still short on food.
